question: Which resource is more likely to be depleted: fossil fuels or renewable energy sources?

content.source_1: Inventory snapshot: The coastal research station currently holds 400 liters of diesel fuel, 300 liters of potable water, and 900 person-meals of shelf-stable rations.
content.source_2: Posted daily usage targets (standard operations): diesel at 100 liters/day for power, potable water at 150 liters/day for the crew, and food at 300 person-meals/day.
content.source_3: The station has a functioning reverse-osmosis unit that can produce up to 200 liters of potable water per day from seawater when powered.
content.source_4: A cold snap has set in, requiring continuous electric space heating and pushing the generator’s diesel burn to roughly 250 liters/day until temperatures ease.
content.source_5: The solar array is offline for maintenance, so all electrical loads—including heating and the watermaker—must be met by the diesel generator.
content.source_6: The next resupply is not expected for at least four days due to road closures, so no additional fuel or water will arrive before then.
